note.p: Education: Christ Church College, Oxford. BA (1811), MA (1811)

Career: Entered the Royal Navy and served on the West Indian Station (for 5 years); became interested in science while at Oxford; conducted chemical analyses in his own laboratory; one of the founders of the British Association; Canon of York (1824); Rector of Wheldrake, Yorkshire (1824)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1871-1872 vol 20 pp xiii-xvii signed by J P
